description: Creates a data store, which is a repository for messages.

parameters.name: datastoreName
parameters.description: The name of the data store.

parameters.name: datastoreStorage
parameters.description: Where data in a data store is stored.. You can choose serviceManagedS3 storage, customerManagedS3 storage, or iotSiteWiseMultiLayerStorage storage. The default is serviceManagedS3. You can't change the choice of Amazon S3 storage after your data store is created. serviceManagedS3 (dict) --- Used to store data in an Amazon S3 bucket managed by IoT Analytics. customerManagedS3 (dict) --- S3-customer-managed; When you choose customer-managed storage, the retentionPeriod parameter is ignored. The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where your data is stored. keyPrefix (string) --- (Optional) The prefix used to create the keys of the data store data objects. Each object in an Amazon S3 bucket has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/). The ARN of the role that grants IoT Analytics permission to interact with your Amazon S3 resources. iotSiteWiseMultiLayerStorage (dict) --- Used to store data used by IoT SiteWise in an Amazon S3 bucket that you manage. Used to store data used by IoT SiteWise in an Amazon S3 bucket that you manage. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).

nested_params.name: serviceManagedS3
nested_params.description: Used to store data in an Amazon S3 bucket managed by IoT Analytics. You can't change the choice of Amazon S3 storage after your data store is created.

nested_params.name: customerManagedS3
nested_params.description: S3-customer-managed; When you choose customer-managed storage, the retentionPeriod parameter is ignored. You can't change the choice of Amazon S3 storage after your data store is created.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where your data is stored.

nested_params.name: keyPrefix
nested_params.description: (Optional) The prefix used to create the keys of the data store data objects. Each object in an Amazon S3 bucket has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT Analytics permission to interact with your Amazon S3 resources.

nested_params.name: iotSiteWiseMultiLayerStorage
nested_params.description: Used to store data used by IoT SiteWise in an Amazon S3 bucket that you manage. You can't change the choice of Amazon S3 storage after your data store is created.

nested_params.name: customerManagedS3Storage
nested_params.description: Used to store data used by IoT SiteWise in an Amazon S3 bucket that you manage.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where your data is stored.

nested_params.name: keyPrefix
nested_params.description: (Optional) The prefix used to create the keys of the data store data objects. Each object in an Amazon S3 bucket has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).

parameters.name: retentionPeriod
parameters.description: How long, in days, message data is kept for the data store. When customerManagedS3 storage is selected, this parameter is ignored. unlimited (boolean) --- If true, message data is kept indefinitely. numberOfDays (integer) --- The number of days that message data is kept. The unlimited parameter must be false.

nested_params.name: unlimited
nested_params.description: If true, message data is kept indefinitely.

nested_params.name: numberOfDays
nested_params.description: The number of days that message data is kept. The unlimited parameter must be false.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the data store. (dict) --- A set of key-value pairs that are used to manage the resource. The tag's key. The tag's value.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: The tag's key.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The tag's value.

parameters.name: fileFormatConfiguration
parameters.description: Contains the configuration information of file formats. IoT Analytics data stores support JSON and Parquet. The default file format is JSON. You can specify only one format. You can't change the file format after you create the data store. jsonConfiguration (dict) --- Contains the configuration information of the JSON format. parquetConfiguration (dict) --- Contains the configuration information of the Parquet format. schemaDefinition (dict) --- Information needed to define a schema. columns (list) --- Specifies one or more columns that store your data. Each schema can have up to 100 columns. Each column can have up to 100 nested types. (dict) --- Contains information about a column that stores your data. The name of the column. The type of data. For more information about the supported data types, see Common data types in the Glue Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: jsonConfiguration
nested_params.description: Contains the configuration information of the JSON format.

nested_params.name: parquetConfiguration
nested_params.description: Contains the configuration information of the Parquet format.

nested_params.name: schemaDefinition
nested_params.description: Information needed to define a schema.

nested_params.name: columns
nested_params.description: Specifies one or more columns that store your data. Each schema can have up to 100 columns. Each column can have up to 100 nested types.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the column.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of data. For more information about the supported data types, see Common data types in the Glue Developer Guide.

parameters.name: datastorePartitions
parameters.description: Contains information about the partition dimensions in a data store. partitions (list) --- A list of partition dimensions in a data store. (dict) --- A single dimension to partition a data store. The dimension must be an AttributePartition or a TimestampPartition. attributePartition (dict) --- A partition dimension defined by an attributeName. The name of the attribute that defines a partition dimension. timestampPartition (dict) --- A partition dimension defined by a timestamp attribute. The attribute name of the partition defined by a timestamp. timestampFormat (string) --- The timestamp format of a partition defined by a timestamp. The default format is seconds since epoch (January 1, 1970 at midnight UTC time).

nested_params.name: partitions
nested_params.description: A list of partition dimensions in a data store.

nested_params.name: attributePartition
nested_params.description: A partition dimension defined by an attributeName.

nested_params.name: attributeName
nested_params.description: The name of the attribute that defines a partition dimension.

nested_params.name: timestampPartition
nested_params.description: A partition dimension defined by a timestamp attribute.

nested_params.name: attributeName
nested_params.description: The attribute name of the partition defined by a timestamp.

nested_params.name: timestampFormat
nested_params.description: The timestamp format of a partition defined by a timestamp. The default format is seconds since epoch (January 1, 1970 at midnight UTC time).

nested_items.name: datastoreName
nested_items.description: The name of the data store.

nested_items.name: datastoreArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the data store.

nested_items.name: retentionPeriod
nested_items.description: How long, in days, message data is kept for the data store.

nested_items.name: unlimited
nested_items.description: If true, message data is kept indefinitely.

nested_items.name: numberOfDays
nested_items.description: The number of days that message data is kept. The unlimited parameter must be false.
